stories.text:
I have 15 years of experience doing backend-focused, full-stack web development. I do lots of ops work at my current job (CI setup, DB provisioning, Server Setup, Load Balancers, Monitoring). However I realize there is always a LOT more to learn when it comes to automating, monitoring and scaling infrastructure. Current cloud experience is in AWS.

Is there a certification I can work towards to make myself a competitive candidate for a DevOps/ DevOps Engineer position? Should I just get certified by GCP / AWS?

Currently making around 250k. I am hoping to make around 300k a year (CA is expensive :( ), please let me know if there is a related position that will help me get to that comp. E.g. should I focus more towards devsecops, etc.

Let me know how I can best position myself - Thank you!
stories.title: What Credentials to Get to Move from Senior Full Stack Dev DevOps?

Hazel: A live functional programming environment featuring typed holes

stories.text: I was thinking of putting together a quick web app to help people quickly search and save code snippets for later use. I wasn't sure if this was something people would be interested in and thought I'd first reach out to the Hacker Community :) thanks for any thoughts
stories.title: Ask HN: Would you use a app to save/share code snippets?
